title: Filter Non-Unique Array Values Based on Function
description: In this lab, we will explore a JavaScript function that filters non-unique array values based on a provided comparator function. By using Array.prototype.filter() and Array.prototype.every(), we will create a new array that contains only the unique values based on the comparator function. This lab aims to improve your understanding of JavaScript array methods and how to use them to manipulate data.

meta.title: Filtering Non-Unique Array Values | JavaScript Coding Practice
meta.description: Learn how to filter out non-unique values from an array using JavaScript array methods. Improve your understanding of data manipulation techniques.
meta.keywords: JavaScript, Array, Filtering, Unique Values, Data Manipulation

steps.title: Filter Non-Unique Array Values Based on Function

verify.name: Verify Node Commands In Zsh History
verify.hint: JavaScript can be run in the Terminal/SSH by typing 'node' and pressing Enter.
